Limited resources: Starting a new business can be challenging, especially if you are doing it alone. You may not have access to the same resources and support as larger, more established companies. This can make it difficult to compete and succeed in your industry.

Competition: Starting a new business can be difficult because you are entering a market with established competitors. It can be challenging to differentiate your business and attract customers away from established brands.

Lack of experience: Starting a new business can be intimidating, especially if you have no prior experience in the industry. You may struggle to navigate the business world and make important decisions that could impact the success of your business.

Burnout: Starting a new business can be all-consuming, and it can be easy to get caught up in the excitement and stress of getting the business off the ground. This can lead to burnout and exhaustion, which can negatively impact your health and the success of your business.

Legal and regulatory issues: Starting a new business can be complicated, and there may be legal and regulatory issues that you need to navigate. This can include obtaining the necessary licenses and permits, as well as complying with tax laws and other regulations.
